channel.title: Need help (port forwarding)
channel.description:
ok im using the v2.5 tutorial. im in step 4. port forwarding. ive taken screenies to make it easier
this picture is from portforwarding.com.. as it said in tutorial i must go here, find my router and follow steps. [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img257.imageshack.us/img257/3462/help4hy6.png[/img][/URL]
now what i dont understand is what number to put in the port. do i put one of the two ports shown in this pic? or do i put the mopar port 43594.
help please :)

item.title: Need help (port forwarding)
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

Lmao, who said I wanna be mod? Mods are over-rated.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help (port forwarding)
item.dc:creator: @mmjack mmjack
item.description:
@mmjack wrote:

Ok for future notice Xun if you dont get banned for stupid posting here it is
Port Start:The port of your server
Port end: Same one as the start (Usualy defualt Port)
Port map: Well that is probably your internal ip but i realy dont have a clue Netgear is so much more simple[br][size=1]Posted on: February 09, 2007, 10:32:39 AM[/size][hr]Oh you are a complete bozo Just set port start end and map to 43594 Sorry after closer inspection of the picture that is the way all the other forwards are set
And tcp/udp Is what i use so i dno]

Read full topic
